alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Cumberland; Harnett; Lee; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 10:21PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Cumberland, Harnett, Lee and Wake. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Fayetteville, Cary, Sanford, Pittsboro, Lillington, Fort Bragg, Siler City, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Dunn, Angier, Goldston, Godwin, Pope AFB, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Hope Mills and Spring Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
